intro: Chenopodium oppositifolium, commonly known as lambsquarters, is an annual herbaceous plant belonging to the Amaranthaceae family. It is characterized by its alternate, ovate leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in dense clusters, and its seeds are dispersed by wind. It is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and is often found in disturbed soils, such as fields and roadsides. Chenopodium oppositifolium is also known for its nutritional value and has been used as a food source in various cultures.
